DOC.brief_summary: The aim is to evaluate the time of positive conversion after exposure to smear positive pulmonary tuberculosis (TB) in a platoon of Korean military, a closed communal setting.
DOC.brief_title: The Time of Positive Conversion of Interferon-Î³ Releasing Assay After Tuberculosis Exposure
DOC.detailed_description: In a platoon where TB outbreak occurred, we performed low dose chest CT (LDCT), QuantiFERON-TB gold in tube (QFT) and two-step (0, 4weeks) TST for outbreak investigation. We perform QFT at 0, 2, 4, 8 and 12 weeks after initial investigation for soldiers with negative QFT results, and soldiers with positive QFT and normal LDCT took isoniazid and rifampin for 3 months as treatment of latent TB.
DOC.criteria: All soldiers who assigned to the military platoon where a tuberculosis outbreak occurred Soldiers who could not complete study or refused the study protocol
